intro: Roucheria monsalveae, commonly known as the Monasalvea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Roucheria monsalveae is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cooler, high-altitude environments.
